intro: Hoffmannia peckii var. selloana, commonly known as the Sello's hoffmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
